metadata.description: Marine unit definitions for Alien in the Machine
notes: Defines the starting marines and their attributes
Each marine becomes an entity with multiple components in the ECS system
Future phases will add AI personalities, equipment, and objectives
Keep personalities distinct for interesting AI interactions

marines.name: Sarge

personality.description: Experienced squad leader. Prioritizes team safety and mission completion. Makes tactical decisions and coordinates team movements.

marines.backstory: 20-year veteran with multiple deep-space deployments. Known for bringing everyone home.
marines.appearance: Grizzled, weathered face with regulation buzz cut. Battle scars tell stories of previous encounters.

marines.name: Rook

personality.description: New to the unit but eager to prove themselves. Nervous but competent with technology. Follows orders religiously.
personality.speechPattern: Formal, sometimes stammering under pressure, asks many questions

marines.backstory: Fresh from the academy. This is their first real deployment. Specializes in technical systems and sensors.
marines.appearance: Young, clean-shaven, alert eyes. Still has the eager look of someone untested by real combat.

marines.name: Doc

personality.description: Squad medic with a strong protective instinct. Calm under pressure. Prioritizes saving lives over completing objectives.
personality.speechPattern: Calm, reassuring, uses medical terminology, often checks on others' wellbeing

marines.backstory: Former civilian doctor who enlisted after losing patients in a colony attack. Determined to save lives in dangerous situations.
marines.appearance: Thoughtful expression, gentle hands, carries themselves with the quiet confidence of someone who has seen life and death.

squadInfo.mission: Investigate Research Station Alpha-7 communications blackout
squadInfo.missionBriefing: Research Station Alpha-7 has gone dark. Last transmission indicated possible contamination breach. Investigate, secure survivors, and extract vital research data.

aiPersonalities: Add unique decision-making patterns for each personality type
Different response styles to stress and danger
Conflict resolution between different personality types
aiObjectives: Personal objectives that may conflict with mission goals
